I think CKEditor is doing this, not sure. GIF images are hidden when I try to display them in a textarea. It could be because it's an animated GIF, though even if I first upload it as a file, it does this. E.g.

<img src="/files/inline-files/sample-animation.gif" hidden="" style="display: none !important;">
Ha! :smiley: Was just about to say that it's working for me.
Yeah. This happens when I have to throw up an ad for work but always have an ad blocker

Drupal/Backdrop do not have good support for animated GIFs. Once the uploaded .gif is processed (image styles), it loses its animation. See https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/issues/4301

Better support/handling of animated gifs 路 Issue #4301 路 backdrop/backdrop-issues
